Trigger.Name: TS Timer
Trigger.RegularExpression: 1A:[A-Z0-9]{8}:(?<name>[a-zA-Z-' ]{1,31}) gains the effect of Twin Snakes from [a-zA-Z-' ]{1,31} for (?<time>[\d]{2}[,\.][\d]{2})

Trigger.Name: GetEffect
Trigger.RegularExpression: 1A:[A-Z0-9]{8}:(?<name>[a-zA-Z-' ]{1,31}) gains the effect of Perfect Balance

Trigger.Name: DropEffect
Trigger.RegularExpression: 1E:[A-Z0-9]{8}:(?<name>[a-zA-Z-' ]{1,31}) loses the effect of Perfect Balance

Trigger.Name: Demo Timer
Trigger.RegularExpression: 1A:(?<id>[A-Z0-9]{8}):[\S ]{1,51} gains the effect of Demolish from (?<name>[a-zA-Z-' ]{1,31}) for (?<time>[\d]{2}[,\.][\d]{2})

Trigger.Name: - README (Open and check Description tab!)
Trigger.Description:
--- The Suite itself gets activated in two ways. 1 Either you swap to the Monk job (swap out/into the job if you are already playing monk) - Probably the main way you will be initializing the triggers. 2 You type !gomnk in any FFXIV chat, "/e !gomnk" works if you dont want to have it displayed for others. - Useful if you forgot to start things up before joining a duty or something.
An image should display on your screen when it loaded up properly, unless you deleted the splash action then well.. It will load anyway.
- Once the suite has been initialized, it will work through any instance swaps, deaths and whatnot. But if you exit ACT for any reason you have to "restart" the suite.
-------------------------------------------------------
Setup guide!
- Copy the whole suite folder to Local Triggers if you used the Repository feature to add it, thanks! :>
All the setup is in the "- Setup" trigger (Should be below this one!)
1 - Change the links in the variables if you want to use different image combo indicators. ("Set scalar variable (combogifcolor).." & "Set scalar variable (combogif)..") * If you prefer to keep the images on your local drive over loading from the interwebs, it will work fine to use a local "link", such as C:\Program Files (x86)\Advanced Combat Tracker\Triggers\ComboGIFgreen.gif Otherwise keep those variables as is.
2 - Adjust the X and Y position of the proc indicators to their corresponding action on your hotbar. - Open up the "Activate image aura (bootcombo/dkcombo/etc..)" actions and adjust one by one - Use the "Use visual guide for placement" button for easy positioning, - Basically you move the image and right click & Save changes. - Tweak the X/Y pixel values to get more precice. - Remember you can use the "Test Action" button to see exactly where it will be and how it will look. - Tweak the Width/Height values if necessary. For a 110% size hotbar and 48x48 seems perfect, but you might use something else.
You should be all set at this point really.
3 - If you don't like the little splash image that shows up when the suite is intialized, delete the actions starting with - Activate image aura (SupaLoada).. - After (5000)ms, deactivate.. In the Setup trigger..
-------------------------------------------------------
Some things to note:
*** I am not claiming this will make you play monk perfectly, nor that it will 100% tell you the correct button to press every time. *** It's a suite of simple helpers, that I made because sometimes my brainpower is too small to know wtf I am doing. It is not an AI.
* All the timings in this "suite" are assuming you are playing with GL4, around 1k SKS and want twin > true > true > twin as your raptor GCD rotation - If you prefer a "normal" Twin> True > Twin > True rotation, adjust the opacity expression of "Activate image aura (tscombo)" to something like "(((${var:tstime}-${_systemtimems})<7000)*${var:mRaptor})*100" (specifically changing the 4000 to something like 7000 should be enough) - Yes, this means this is probably ill-suited for sub level 80 play. - Yes this also means that it might not make ideal suggestions if you drop down to GL3 Fists of Fire for burst, I can't really say tbh.
I guess you might just have to play monk by yourself in your daily dose of Alliance raid.
* Demo does NOT track demo on multiple targets, sorry. I tried to make this work but it was a headache keeping all the dot timers going on multiple target IDs in a good way. So I'll stick with this basic method of just counting down from the last demo application for now.
* There will be nothing shown for the first raw/stanceless gcd after PB has faded. This is simply because the action you want to take is too situational and I can't really guess it for you. I believe most of the time you just want to raw DK though, even with leaden fist up, as you wont guarantee the crit. But I am not a mentor nor a monk expert so don't listen to me.
